newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil shares rebound, end up tracking Wall Street.
newsitem.headline: Brazil shares rebound, end up tracking Wall Street.

text.p: Brazil shares ended 1.04 percent higher on Tuesday after falling earlier as Wall Street stock prices recouped from some of their recent losses, brokers said.
The Bovespa index of the 49 most traded stocks closed at 9,138 points. Volume improved, totalling 593.2 million reais ($559.6 million).
Analysts said local shares, which recently have been taking their cue from Wall Street, could firm on Wednesday if U.S. stocks keep trading higher.
Bellwether Telebras preferred closed at 111.60 reais, up 1.82 percent.
Its common stock rose 1.6 percent to 108.50 reais.
State mining giant Companhia Vale do Rio Doce gained 1.04 percent, closing at 24.35 reais.
Federal oil firm Petrobras preferred fel 0.24 percent, ending at 210 reais.
The power sector index, comprising the nine most liquid stocks of the electrical sector, closed off 0.62 percent at 2,479 points.
